author: Staff Reporter
text:
A highly decomposed carcass of a leopard was found in the Durgam Reserve Forest area in Ambur range. Villagers, on spotting the carcass, informed the personnel of the Ambur Forest Range on Tuesday night.

Following this, the personnel went to the spot and found that the carcass was highly decomposed.

“The carcass was found in the reserve forest area, about three kilometers away from Bairapalli village. At least 90 per cent of the body was decomposed. The animal should have been dead for at least 10 to 15 days,” an officer said.

Post-mortem was carried out on Wednesday. Following orders from senior officials, the range officers burned the remains of the animal.

He added that the age of the animal and cause of death would be known only after the post-mortem report was submitted.

He said that leopards were rarely spotted in this part of the forest range of Vellore district.
title: Decomposed carcass of leopard found in Ambur forest
